headline: Candied Walnuts
description: These crunchy caramelized nuts make a great party snack and require just 2 ingredients. You can also serve them in a salad or sprinkled over ice cream, the possibilities are endless.
name: Candied Walnuts
keywords: Candy, Walnut, American, Dairy-Free, Gluten-Free, Snack, Christmas, Favorite Fall, Favorite Winter, Holiday

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F: Place rack in the middle of the oven.

Toast the walnuts: Lay walnuts out on a baking sheet in a single layer. Bake for 5 minutes, until slightly darker in color and fragrant. If not quite toasted enough, toast for 1 or 2 more minutes. Be careful not to burn them. Remove from the oven and let cool in pan on a rack.

Get everything ready: You'll need to work quickly once the caramelized sugar is ready. So, be sure to have everything prepped and ready to go. Place the cooled walnuts in a bowl near the stove. Line a rimmed baking sheet with a silicon baking mat or parchment paper and place near the stove. Have two forks ready.

Caramelize the sugar: Pour sugar into a medium saucepan with a thick bottom and place over medium heat. Stir with a wooden spoon as the sugar begins to melt. Keep stirring until all the sugar has melted and the color is a medium amber, Five to 10 minutes (exact timing will depend on your stove top).

Coat the walnuts in caramelized sugar: As soon as sugar has melted and the color is a medium amber, add the walnuts to the pan. Stir quickly and make sure each piece is coated with the liquid sugar. As soon as the walnuts are coated with the sugar mixture, spread them out on the prepared baking sheet. Use two forks to separate the walnuts from each other, working very quickly. Sprinkle the nuts with the salt.
Cool and store: Let the walnuts cool completely. Transfer to an airtight container and store for up to a week at room temperature. Did you enjoy this recipe? Let us know with a rating and review!

review.reviewBody:
Very good and easy.
Nothing to change, but just a specific suggestion...I was looking for sweet, smokey & hot, so added less than a 1/4 teaspoon of smoked chili peppers to the sugar before cooking. Came out great.
Again, just a suggestion for a specific crave, recipe is perfect as is.
Just made this recipe supper simple and delicious. Just a tip, if you don’t want your sugar sticking to your pan or spoon add 2 tablespoons butter.

I have made this Chinese-style. One of the secrets I found was to blanch (simmer) the walnuts for 10 minutes before toasting. This removes the bitterness which can be very pronounced to some people with walnuts. The second lovely addition is to sprinkle sesame seeds (toasted if you like) over the nuts at the point where this recipe says to sprinkle with salt. The extra flavor is amazing. Just some thoughts. :)

I haven't done these yet, but after looking at several other recipes I liked the simplicity of this one. 
Would adding a teaspoon of vanilla help enhance the flavor?
Delicious! I did add a touch of hot Hungarian paprika
